Package components

Class Hub

java.lang.Object
components.Branch
components.Hub
All Implemented Interfaces:
Node
public class Hub
extends Branch
This class represents a hub branch - a branch that acts as a sorting center where all packages from local branches are sent to after initial collection. After sorting, packages are dispatched from the hub to the matching local branches of the destination address
Version:
1.00 7 Apr 2021
Author:
Israel Avihail 308298363, Ofir Golan 315585323
See Also:
Branch, Package, StandardTruck, NonStandardTruck

    Constructors

    Hub()
    Class constructor initiates the list of branches and the current branch to send a standard truck to

    void setBranches​(java.util.ArrayList<Branch> branches)
    Set method for the list of branches that belong to the hub
    void work()
    This method represents work of the hub - manages every truck under the hub (by activating it's work method), loads it's trucks with packages and sends them to the appropriate branch: if a standard truck is available, all packages of the current branch are loaded on it and the truck is sent to dispatch the packages.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hub

      public Hub()

  • Method Details

    • work

      public void work()
      This method represents work of the hub - manages every truck under the hub (by activating it's work method), loads it's trucks with packages and sends them to the appropriate branch: if a standard truck is available, all packages of the current branch are loaded on it and the truck is sent to dispatch the packages. If a non standard package is to be collected and delivered and the a non standard truck is available, it is then sent to collect it
      Specified by:
      work in interface Node
      Overrides:
      work in class Branch

    • nextBranch

      public int nextBranch()
      This method generates the next branch id send a standard truck to
      Returns:
      the id of the next branch to send a truck to
